artifact.content: Grant administrator access through system console.
Administrator can find available phone numbers.
Administrator can find available IP address.
Administrator can associate an IP address to a phone number.
The administrator can map the IP address and phone number to a customer�s account.
Grant accounts the ability to originate and receive calls.
Administrator can block incoming calls to an account.
Administrator can exclusively allow incoming calls to an account.
Administrator can disassociate an IP address and number pair from a customer�s account.
Administrator can disassociate an IP address from an number.
Administrator can view associates between phone numbers, IP address and customer accounts.
Administrator can view which devices, if any, are out of service.
Administrator can take a phone out of service.
Administrator can put a phone back in service.
System alerts administrator of any errors that occur.
Administrator can reset any phone.
System periodically runs automated hardware fault tests on itself. Administrator can view results of tests in report form.
Administrator can set the maximum number of allowable connections between phones.
System can store records of calls made.
Administrator can print a bill for a customer�s account.
System calculates and includes taxes on bills.
If customer fails to make a bill payment, a warning appears on the next bill.
At the end if each customer�s billing period, system will automatically print out a bill.
Administrator can assign a billing plan to a customer.
Administrator can create a new billing plan.
Administrator can view the details of any customer�s account.
Administrators can create new administrative accounts.
The administrator can take a customer�s information and create a new account for him/her with a billing plan.
The administrator can suspend a user�s account.
The administrator can cancel a customer�s account.
Accounts that have been suspended for 30 days automatically become cancelled.
Administrator can view the history of a system loads in graph form.
Administrator can log out of the system console.
If an administrative is inactive for five minutes, then he is automatically logged out.
The caller will hear a dial tone before placing a call.
The user will be able to dial a number to make a call.
The system will ensure that the number of current connections is less than maximum number of allowable connections before allowing a new call.
The system can establish a connection between two phones.
The system can disconnect a call between two phones.
If system will be able to detect if a phone is left off the hook.
If a phone tries to establish a connection with another phone under certain conditions, then the caller will receive a busy signal.
Billing periods for customers can start on different days for each customer.
Phone numbers shall belong to groups, which represent their areas. Calling phone numbers outside the group will incur long distance charges.
If the callee does not pick up the phone when being called, after five minutes of ringing the call disconnections.
The system only will only allow one administrator to be logged in at one time.
The administrator should be able to access the system console through a TCP/IP protocol.
All error messages will be assigned severity levels.
Administrator can reverse the suspension of a customer�s account.
A user can call the administrator (0000) at any time
The phone system must be consistently available for customer use, both in making and receiving calls.
The phone system should be built to handle small numbers of customer accounts and phones, as well as large numbers of accounts and phones.
The phone network and administration systems should be secure and unavailable to unauthorized users.
The phone system should respond promptly to both administrators and customers using the phone system.
The phone system should be available for use by the customers and administrators for the vast majority of times.
The system should function reliably, responding correctly to the administrator and customer commands, not giving frequent errors or crashing.
No customers should be able to make phone calls without being charged for them.
The administration system console should be easy for administrators to use. Functions should be intuitive so that administrators can use them with minimal training.
The telephone interface and feedback should provide customers with an experience consistent with other telephone systems.
